elements.description:
Graphics adapter family.
Identifies the type of graphics backend used by the rendering system

members.doc: No adapter detected. Used as an error state or uninitialized value
members.name: ADAPTER_FAMILY_NONE

members.doc: Null (dummy) backend. Used for headless operation, testing, or environments where rendering output is not required
members.name: ADAPTER_FAMILY_NULL

members.doc: OpenGL desktop backend. Common on Windows, macOS and Linux systems
members.name: ADAPTER_FAMILY_OPENGL

members.doc: OpenGL ES backend. Primarily used on mobile devices (Android, iOS), as well as WebGL (browser)
members.name: ADAPTER_FAMILY_OPENGLES

members.doc: Vulkan backend. Cross-platform modern graphics API with explicit control over GPU resources and multithreading
members.name: ADAPTER_FAMILY_VULKAN

members.doc: Vendor-specific backend. A placeholder for proprietary or experimental APIs tied to a particular GPU vendor.
members.name: ADAPTER_FAMILY_VENDOR

members.doc: WebGPU backend. Modern web graphics API designed as the successor to WebGL
members.name: ADAPTER_FAMILY_WEBGPU

members.doc: DirectX backend. Microsoft’s graphics API used on Windows and Xbox
members.name: ADAPTER_FAMILY_DIRECTX

elements.name: AdapterFamily

elements.brief: Adds a stream to a vertex stream declaration
elements.description: Adds a stream to a vertex stream declaration
elements.name: AddVertexStream

parameters.doc: the size of the stream, i.e number of components
parameters.name: size

parameters.doc: the data type of the stream
parameters.name: type

parameters.doc: true if the stream should be normalized in the 0..1 range
parameters.name: normalize

elements.brief: Adds a stream to a vertex stream declaration
elements.description: Adds a stream to a vertex stream declaration
elements.name: AddVertexStream

parameters.doc: the name hash of the stream
parameters.name: name_hash

parameters.doc: the size of the stream, i.e number of components
parameters.name: size

parameters.doc: the data type of the stream
parameters.name: type

parameters.doc: true if the stream should be normalized in the 0..1 range
parameters.name: normalize

elements.brief: Defines how an attachment should be treated at the...
elements.description: Defines how an attachment should be treated at the start and end of a render pass

members.doc: Ignore existing content, no guarantees about the result
members.name: ATTACHMENT_OP_DONT_CARE

members.doc: Preserve the existing contents of the attachment
members.name: ATTACHMENT_OP_LOAD

members.doc: Store the attachment’s results after the pass finishes
members.name: ATTACHMENT_OP_STORE

members.doc: Clear the attachment to a predefined value at the beginning of the pass
members.name: ATTACHMENT_OP_CLEAR

elements.name: AttachmentOp

elements.description:
Begins frame rendering.
Prepares the graphics context for rendering a new frame.
This should be called at the start of each frame.
elements.name: BeginFrame

elements.description:
Blend factors for color blending.
Defines how source and destination colors are combined

members.doc: Always use 0.0
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_ZERO

members.doc: Always use 1.0
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_ONE

members.doc: Use source color
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_SRC_COLOR

members.doc: Use (1 - source color)
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_ONE_MINUS_SRC_COLOR

members.doc: Use destination color
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_DST_COLOR

members.doc: Use (1 - destination color)
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_ONE_MINUS_DST_COLOR

members.doc: Use source alpha
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_SRC_ALPHA

members.doc: Use (1 - source alpha)
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_ONE_MINUS_SRC_ALPHA

members.doc: Use destination alpha
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_DST_ALPHA

members.doc: Use (1 - destination alpha)
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA

members.doc: Use min(srcAlpha, 1 - dstAlpha)
members.name: BLEND_FACTOR_SRC_ALPHA_SATURATE

elements.name: BlendFactor

elements.description:
Buffer usage hints.
Indicates how often the data in a buffer will be updated.
Helps the driver optimize memory placement

members.doc: Updated every frame, used once (e.g. dynamic geometry)
members.name: BUFFER_USAGE_STREAM_DRAW

members.doc: Updated occasionally, used many times
members.name: BUFFER_USAGE_DYNAMIC_DRAW

members.doc: Set once, used many times (e.g. meshes, textures). Preferred for buffers that never change
members.name: BUFFER_USAGE_STATIC_DRAW

elements.name: BufferUsage

elements.description:
Clears the render target buffers.
Fills the specified buffers with predefined values. Commonly used at the
beginning of a frame to clear the screen to a specific color and depth.
elements.name: Clear

parameters.doc: Bitmask specifying which buffers to clear (BUFFER_TYPE_*)
parameters.name: flags

parameters.doc: Depth value to clear depth buffer to
parameters.name: depth

parameters.doc: Stencil value to clear stencil buffer to
parameters.name: stencil

elements.brief: Closes the window associated with the graphics con...
elements.description:
Closes the window associated with the graphics context.
If a window is open, this will close it and clean up associated resources.
elements.name: CloseWindow

elements.brief: Depth and alpha test comparison functions
elements.description:
Depth and alpha test comparison functions.
Defines how incoming values are compared against stored ones

members.doc: Never passes.
members.name: COMPARE_FUNC_NEVER

members.doc: Passes if incoming < stored
members.name: COMPARE_FUNC_LESS

members.doc: Passes if incoming <= stored
members.name: COMPARE_FUNC_LEQUAL

members.doc: Passes if incoming > stored
members.name: COMPARE_FUNC_GREATER

members.doc: Passes if incoming >= stored
members.name: COMPARE_FUNC_GEQUAL

members.doc: Passes if incoming == stored
members.name: COMPARE_FUNC_EQUAL

members.doc: Passes if incoming != stored
members.name: COMPARE_FUNC_NOTEQUAL

members.doc: Always passes (ignores stored values)
members.name: COMPARE_FUNC_ALWAYS

elements.name: CompareFunc

elements.description:
Graphics context creation parameters.
Defines the configuration for creating a new graphics context.
This structure is used when initializing the graphics system and
specifies window association, job system context, texture filtering defaults,
resolution, memory limits, and various debugging/validation options.

members.doc: Platform window handle to associate with the graphics context
members.name: m_Window

members.doc: Job system context for asynchronous operations
members.name: m_JobContext

members.doc: Default minification filter for textures
members.name: m_DefaultTextureMinFilter

members.doc: Default magnification filter for textures
members.name: m_DefaultTextureMagFilter

members.doc: Initial width of the rendering surface
members.name: m_Width

members.doc: Initial height of the rendering surface
members.name: m_Height

members.doc: Maximum allowed graphics memory in bytes (0 for default/unlimited) (Switch)
members.name: m_GraphicsMemorySize

members.doc: Vertical synchronization interval (1 for 60Hz, 2 for 30Hz, etc.) (Default = 1)
members.name: m_SwapInterval

members.doc: Enable API call verification for debugging
members.name: m_VerifyGraphicsCalls

members.doc: Print graphics device information at startup
members.name: m_PrintDeviceInfo

members.doc: Enable validation layers for debugging (Vulkan/DirectX 12 only)
members.name: m_UseValidationLayers

elements.name: ContextParams

elements.description:
Destroys a graphics context.
Cleans up all resources associated with the graphics context.
The context becomes invalid after this call.
elements.name: DeleteContext

elements.description: Delete the index buffer
elements.name: DeleteIndexBuffer

elements.brief: Destroys a shader program and frees associated res...
elements.description:
Destroys a shader program and frees associated resources.
Cleans up GPU memory and resources associated with the program handle.
The handle becomes invalid after this call.
elements.name: DeleteProgram

elements.description: Delete texture
elements.name: DeleteTexture

elements.description: Delete vertex buffer
elements.name: DeleteVertexBuffer

elements.description: Delete vertex declaration
elements.name: DeleteVertexDeclaration

elements.description: Delete vertex stream declaration
elements.name: DeleteVertexStreamDeclaration

elements.brief: Deactivates the currently bound shader program
elements.description:
Deactivates the currently bound shader program.
Unbinds any active program from the graphics pipeline, returning to the default state
where no custom shader program is active.
elements.name: DisableProgram

elements.brief: Disable a texture bound to a texture unit
elements.description:
Disable a texture bound to a texture unit.
Unbinds the given texture handle from the specified unit,
releasing the association in the graphics pipeline.
This is useful to prevent unintended reuse of textures,
or to free up texture units for other bindings.
elements.name: DisableTexture

parameters.doc: Texture unit index to disable. Must match the one previously used in dmGraphics::EnableTexture
parameters.name: unit

parameters.doc: Handle to the texture object to disable
parameters.name: texture

elements.brief: Unbinds a vertex buffer from the graphics pipeline
elements.description:
Unbinds a vertex buffer from the graphics pipeline.
Removes the association between a vertex buffer and its binding index,
freeing up the binding slot for other buffers.
elements.name: DisableVertexBuffer

elements.brief: Unbinds a vertex declaration from the graphics pip...
elements.description:
Unbinds a vertex declaration from the graphics pipeline.
Removes the association between a vertex declaration and its binding index,
freeing up the binding slot for other declarations.
elements.name: DisableVertexDeclaration

elements.description:
Draws non-indexed primitives.
Renders geometry using vertex data directly from the bound vertex buffers
without index buffer indirection. The vertices are processed sequentially
from the specified starting point.
elements.name: Draw

parameters.doc: Index of the first vertex to draw
parameters.name: first

parameters.doc: Number of instances to draw (for instanced rendering)
parameters.name: instance_count

elements.brief: Activates a shader program for rendering
elements.description:
Activates a shader program for rendering.
Binds the specified program to the graphics pipeline, making it the active program
for all subsequent rendering operations until another program is activated or disabled.
elements.name: EnableProgram

elements.brief: Enable and bind a texture to a texture unit
elements.description:
Enable and bind a texture to a texture unit.
Associates a texture object with a specific texture unit in the
graphics context, making it available for sampling in shaders.
Multiple textures can be active simultaneously by binding them
to different units. The shader must reference the correct unit
(via sampler uniform) to access the bound texture
elements.name: EnableTexture

parameters.doc: Texture unit index to bind the texture to. Valid range depends on GPU capabilities (commonly 0–15 for at least 16 texture units)
parameters.name: unit

parameters.doc: Index for internal tracking or binding variation. Typically used when multiple texture IDs are managed within the same unit (e.g. array textures or multi-bind)
parameters.name: id_index

parameters.doc: Handle to the texture object to enable and bind
parameters.name: texture

elements.brief: Binds a vertex buffer for rendering
elements.description:
Binds a vertex buffer for rendering.
Associates a vertex buffer with a specific binding index in the graphics pipeline.
The buffer provides the actual vertex data that will be processed according to
the active vertex declaration for that binding index.
elements.name: EnableVertexBuffer

parameters.doc: Binding index to associate with this buffer
parameters.name: binding_index

elements.brief: Binds a vertex declaration for rendering
elements.description:
Binds a vertex declaration for rendering.
Associates a vertex declaration with a specific binding index in the graphics pipeline.
The declaration defines how vertex data is interpreted and laid out in memory.
elements.name: EnableVertexDeclaration

parameters.doc: Binding index to associate with this declaration
parameters.name: binding_index

parameters.doc: Byte offset to add to all vertex attribute pointers
parameters.name: base_offset

parameters.doc: Shader program to use with this declaration
parameters.name: program

elements.description:
Finalizes the graphics system.
Cleans up global graphics resources and shuts down the graphics system.
This should be called when the application is exiting.
elements.name: Finalize

elements.brief: Finds the location of a uniform variable in a shad...
elements.description:
Finds the location of a uniform variable in a shader program by name hash.
Returns the uniform location that can be used with other uniform-setting functions.
This is the preferred method when the uniform name is known at compile time
as it avoids runtime string hashing.
elements.name: FindUniformLocation

parameters.doc: Hash of the uniform variable name
parameters.name: name_hash

returnvalues.doc: Uniform location handle, or INVALID_UNIFORM_LOCATION if not found
returnvalues.name: location

elements.brief: Finds the location of a uniform variable in a shad...
elements.description:
Finds the location of a uniform variable in a shader program by name string.
Returns the uniform location that can be used with other uniform-setting functions.
This method is useful when the uniform name is only known at runtime.
elements.name: FindUniformLocation

returnvalues.doc: Uniform location handle, or INVALID_UNIFORM_LOCATION if not found
returnvalues.name: location

elements.description:
Flips screen buffers.
Presents the rendered frame to the display.
This should be called at the end of each frame after all rendering is complete.
elements.name: Flip

elements.brief: Gets the adapter family from a string name
elements.description:
Gets the adapter family from a string name.
Converts a string identifier to the corresponding AdapterFamily enum value.
elements.name: GetAdapterFamily

elements.brief: Get the scale factor of the display
elements.description:
Get the scale factor of the display.
The display scale factor is usally 1.0 but will for instance be 2.0 on a macOS Retina display.
elements.name: GetDisplayScaleFactor

elements.brief: Returns the specified height of the opened window,...
elements.description: Returns the specified height of the opened window, which might differ from the actual window width.
elements.name: GetHeight

returnvalues.doc: Specified height of the window. If no window is opened, 0 is always returned.
returnvalues.name: height

elements.description: Get installed graphics adapter family
elements.name: GetInstalledAdapterFamily

elements.brief: Get the max number of indices allowed by the syste...
elements.description: Get the max number of indices allowed by the system in an index buffer
elements.name: GetMaxElementsIndices

elements.brief: Get the max number of vertices allowed by the syst...
elements.description: Get the max number of vertices allowed by the system in a vertex buffer
elements.name: GetMaxElementsVertices

elements.brief: Get maximum supported size in pixels of non-array ...
elements.description: Get maximum supported size in pixels of non-array texture
elements.name: GetMaxTextureSize

returnvalues.doc: Maximum texture size supported by GPU
returnvalues.name: max_texture_size

elements.brief: Get how many platform-dependent texture handle use...
elements.description:
Get how many platform-dependent texture handle used for engine texture handle.
Applicable only for OpenGL/ES backend. All other backends return 1.
elements.name: GetNumTextureHandles

elements.brief: Get texture original (before uploading to GPU) hei...
elements.description: Get texture original (before uploading to GPU) height
elements.name: GetOriginalTextureHeight

elements.brief: Get texture original (before uploading to GPU) wid...
elements.description: Get texture original (before uploading to GPU) width
elements.name: GetOriginalTextureWidth

elements.brief: Get the attachment texture from a render target. R...
elements.description: Get the attachment texture from a render target. Returns zero if no such attachment texture exists.
elements.name: GetRenderTargetAttachment

elements.description: get the supported extension
elements.name: GetSupportedExtension

returnvalues.doc: the extension. 0 if index was out of bounds
returnvalues.name: extension

elements.brief: Get texture depth. applicable for 3D and cube map ...
elements.description: Get texture depth. applicable for 3D and cube map textures
elements.name: GetTextureDepth

elements.brief: Get string representation of texture format
elements.description: Get string representation of texture format
elements.name: GetTextureFormatLiteral

elements.brief: Get the native graphics API texture object from an...
elements.description:
Get the native graphics API texture object from an engine texture handle. This depends on the graphics backend and is not
guaranteed to be implemented on the currently running adapter.
elements.name: GetTextureHandle

parameters.doc: a pointer to where the raw object should be stored
parameters.name: out_handle

elements.description: Get texture height
elements.name: GetTextureHeight

elements.description: Get texture mipmap count
elements.name: GetTextureMipmapCount

elements.brief: Get approximate size of how much memory texture co...
elements.description: Get approximate size of how much memory texture consumes
elements.name: GetTextureResourceSize

elements.description: Get status of texture
elements.name: GetTextureStatusFlags

elements.description: Get texture type
elements.name: GetTextureType

elements.brief: Get string representation of texture type
elements.description: Get string representation of texture type
elements.name: GetTextureTypeLiteral

elements.brief: Query usage hint flags for a texture
elements.description:
Query usage hint flags for a texture.
Retrieves the bitwise usage flags that were assigned to a texture
when it was created. These flags indicate the intended role(s) of
the texture in the rendering pipeline and allow the graphics
backend to apply optimizations or enforce restrictions
elements.name: GetTextureUsageHintFlags

returnvalues.doc: A bitwise OR of usage flags describing how the texture may be used. Applications can test specific flags using bitmask operations
returnvalues.name: flags

elements.description: Get texture width
elements.name: GetTextureWidth

elements.brief: Get the physical offset into the vertex data for a...
elements.description: Get the physical offset into the vertex data for a particular stream
elements.name: GetVertexStreamOffset

parameters.doc: the name hash of the vertex stream (as passed into AddVertexStream())
parameters.name: name_hash

returnvalues.doc: in bytes into the vertex or INVALID_STREAM_OFFSET if not found
returnvalues.name: Offset

elements.description: Get viewport's parameters
elements.name: GetViewport

elements.brief: Returns the specified width of the opened window, ...
elements.description: Returns the specified width of the opened window, which might differ from the actual window width.
elements.name: GetWidth

returnvalues.doc: Specified width of the window. If no window is opened, 0 is always returned.
returnvalues.name: width

elements.brief: Return the height of the opened window, if any.
elements.description: Return the height of the opened window, if any.
elements.name: GetWindowHeight

returnvalues.doc: Height of the window. If no window is opened, 0 is always returned
returnvalues.name: window_height

elements.brief: Return the width of the opened window, if any.
elements.description: Return the width of the opened window, if any.
elements.name: GetWindowWidth

returnvalues.doc: Width of the window. If no window is opened, 0 is always returned
returnvalues.name: window_width

elements.description: Function's call result code

members.doc: The function's call succeeded and returned a valid result
members.name: HANDLE_RESULT_OK

members.doc: The function is not supported by the current graphics backend
members.name: HANDLE_RESULT_NOT_AVAILABLE

members.doc: An error occurred while function call
members.name: HANDLE_RESULT_ERROR

elements.name: HandleResult

elements.description: Context handle
elements.name: HContext

elements.description: Index buffer handle
elements.name: HIndexBuffer

elements.description: Program handle
elements.name: HProgram

elements.description: Rendertarget handle
elements.name: HRenderTarget

elements.description: Storage buffer handle
elements.name: HStorageBuffer

elements.description: Texture handle
elements.name: HTexture

elements.description: Uniform location handle
elements.name: HUniformLocation

elements.description: Vertex buffer handle
elements.name: HVertexBuffer

elements.description: Vertex declaration handle
elements.name: HVertexDeclaration

elements.description: Vertex stream declaration handle
elements.name: HVertexStreamDeclaration

elements.description:
Index buffer element types.
Defines the integer size used for vertex indices

members.doc: 16-bit unsigned integers (max 65535 vertices)
members.name: INDEXBUFFER_FORMAT_16

members.doc: 32-bit unsigned integers (supports larger meshes)
members.name: INDEXBUFFER_FORMAT_32

elements.name: IndexBufferFormat

elements.description:
Installs a graphics adapter.
Initializes the specified graphics backend (OpenGL, Vulkan, etc.).
This must be called before creating any graphics context.
elements.name: InstallAdapter

returnvalues.doc: True if the adapter was successfully installed, false otherwise
returnvalues.name: success

elements.description:
Invalid program handle constant.
Used to represent an uninitialized or invalid program handle.
Can be used to check if program creation or loading failed.
elements.name: INVALID_PROGRAM_HANDLE

elements.description: Invalid stream offset
elements.name: INVALID_STREAM_OFFSET

elements.description:
Invalid uniform location constant.
Used to represent an uninitialized or invalid uniform location.
Can be used to check if uniform location lookup failed.
elements.name: INVALID_UNIFORM_LOCATION

elements.brief: check if an extension is supported
elements.description: check if an extension is supported
elements.name: IsExtensionSupported

returnvalues.doc: true if the extension was supported
returnvalues.name: result

elements.brief: Check if the index format is supported
elements.description: Check if the index format is supported
elements.name: IsIndexBufferFormatSupported

parameters.doc: true if the format is supoprted
parameters.name: result

elements.brief: check if a specific texture format is supported
elements.description: check if a specific texture format is supported
elements.name: IsTextureFormatSupported

returnvalues.doc: true if the texture format was supported
returnvalues.name: result

elements.description: Max buffer color attachments
elements.name: MAX_BUFFER_COLOR_ATTACHMENTS

elements.description:
Creates a new graphics context.
Initializes the graphics system with the specified parameters.
Only one graphics context can be active at a time.
elements.name: NewContext

returnvalues.doc: New graphics context handle, or null on failure
returnvalues.name: context

elements.brief: Create new index buffer with initial data
elements.description: Create new index buffer with initial data
elements.name: NewIndexBuffer
notes: The caller need to track if the indices are 16 or 32 bit.

parameters.doc: the size of the buffer (in bytes). May be 0
parameters.name: size

elements.brief: Creates a new shader program from a shader descrip...
elements.description:
Creates a new shader program from a shader description.
Compiles and links shader sources defined in the ShaderDesc into a GPU program.
Returns a program handle that can be used for rendering.
elements.name: NewProgram

parameters.doc: Shader description containing source code and parameters
parameters.name: ddf

parameters.doc: Buffer to receive error messages (can be null)
parameters.name: error_buffer

returnvalues.doc: New program handle, or INVALID_PROGRAM_HANDLE on failure
returnvalues.name: program

elements.description: Create new texture
elements.name: NewTexture

elements.brief: Create new vertex buffer with initial data
elements.description: Create new vertex buffer with initial data

parameters.doc: the size of the buffer (in bytes). May be 0

elements.brief: Create new vertex declaration from a vertex stream...
elements.description: Create new vertex declaration from a vertex stream declaration
elements.name: NewVertexDeclaration

elements.brief: Create new vertex declaration from a vertex stream...
elements.description:
Create new vertex declaration from a vertex stream declaration and an explicit stride value,
where the stride is the number of bytes between each consecutive vertex in a vertex buffer
elements.name: NewVertexDeclaration

parameters.doc: the stride between the start of each vertex (in bytes)
parameters.name: stride

elements.brief: Create new vertex stream declaration. A stream dec...
elements.description:
Create new vertex stream declaration. A stream declaration contains a list of vertex streams
that should be used to create a vertex declaration from.
elements.name: NewVertexStreamDeclaration

elements.brief: Create new vertex stream declaration. A stream dec...
elements.description:
Create new vertex stream declaration. A stream declaration contains a list of vertex streams
that should be used to create a vertex declaration from.
elements.name: NewVertexStreamDeclaration

parameters.doc: the vertex step function to use
parameters.name: step_function

elements.description:
Primitive drawing modes.
Defines how vertex data is assembled into primitives

members.doc: Each pair of vertices forms a line
members.name: PRIMITIVE_LINES

members.doc: Each group of 3 vertices forms a triangle
members.name: PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLES

members.doc: Connected strip of triangles (shares vertices)
members.name: PRIMITIVE_TRIANGLE_STRIP

elements.name: PrimitiveType

elements.brief: Read frame buffer pixels in BGRA format
elements.description: Read frame buffer pixels in BGRA format
elements.name: ReadPixels

elements.description: Attachment points for render targets

members.doc: A color buffer attachment (used for rendering visible output)

members.doc: A depth buffer attachment (used for depth testing)
members.name: ATTACHMENT_DEPTH

members.doc: A stencil buffer attachment (used for stencil operations)

elements.description: Set index buffer data

parameters.doc: the size of the buffer (in bytes). May be 0

elements.description: Set subset of index buffer data

parameters.doc: the offset into the desination buffer (in bytes)

parameters.doc: the size of the buffer (in bytes). May be 0

elements.brief: Binds a texture sampler to a texture unit
elements.description:
Binds a texture sampler to a texture unit.
Associates a texture with a specific sampler uniform in the shader,
allowing the shader to access the texture data during rendering.
elements.name: SetSampler

parameters.doc: Texture unit index to bind to
parameters.name: unit

elements.brief: Set texture data. For textures of type TEXTURE_TYP...
elements.description:
Set texture data. For textures of type TEXTURE_TYPE_CUBE_MAP it's assumed that
6 mip-maps are present contiguously in memory with stride m_DataSize
elements.name: SetTexture

elements.brief: Set texture data asynchronously. For textures of t...
elements.description:
Set texture data asynchronously. For textures of type TEXTURE_TYPE_CUBE_MAP it's assumed that
6 mip-maps are present contiguously in memory with stride m_DataSize
elements.name: SetTextureAsync

parameters.doc: Texture parameters. Texture will be recreated if parameters differ from creation parameters
parameters.name: params

parameters.doc: User data that will be passed to completion callback
parameters.name: user_data

elements.brief: Function called when a texture has been set asynch...
elements.description: Function called when a texture has been set asynchronously
elements.name: SetTextureAsyncCallback

parameters.doc: User data that will be passed to the SetTextureAsyncCallback
parameters.name: user_data

elements.description: Set texture parameters
elements.name: SetTextureParams

parameters.doc: Wrapping mode for the U (X) texture coordinate.
parameters.name: uwrap

parameters.doc: Wrapping mode for the V (Y) texture coordinate
parameters.name: vwrap

elements.description: Set vertex buffer data
elements.name: SetVertexBufferData

parameters.doc: the size of the buffer (in bytes). May be 0
parameters.name: size

elements.brief: Set subset of vertex buffer data
elements.description: Set subset of vertex buffer data
elements.name: SetVertexBufferSubData

parameters.doc: the offset into the desination buffer (in bytes)
parameters.name: offset

parameters.doc: the size of the buffer (in bytes). May be 0
parameters.name: size

elements.description:
Sets the viewport for rendering.
Defines the affine transformation from normalized device coordinates to window coordinates.
This affects all subsequent rendering operations.
elements.name: SetViewport

parameters.doc: X coordinate of the viewport's origin (in pixels)
parameters.name: x

parameters.doc: Y coordinate of the viewport's origin (in pixels)
parameters.name: y

elements.description: Shader program description (from graphics_ddf.h)
elements.name: ShaderDesc

elements.description:
Stencil test actions.
Defines what happens to a stencil buffer value depending on the outcome of the stencil/depth test.

members.doc: Keep the current stencil value
members.name: STENCIL_OP_KEEP

members.doc: Set stencil value to 0
members.name: STENCIL_OP_ZERO

members.doc: Replace stencil value with reference value
members.name: STENCIL_OP_REPLACE

members.doc: Increment stencil value (clamps at max)
members.name: STENCIL_OP_INCR

members.doc: Increment stencil value, wrapping around
members.name: STENCIL_OP_INCR_WRAP

members.doc: Decrement stencil value (clamps at 0)
members.name: STENCIL_OP_DECR

members.doc: Decrement stencil value, wrapping around
members.name: STENCIL_OP_DECR_WRAP

members.doc: Bitwise invert stencil value
members.name: STENCIL_OP_INVERT

elements.name: StencilOp

elements.description:
Texture creation parameters.
Defines how a texture is created, initialized, and used.
This structure is typically passed when allocating GPU memory
for a new texture. It controls dimensions, format, layering,
mipmapping, and intended usage.

members.doc: Texture type. Defines the dimensionality and interpretation of the texture (2D, 3D, cube map, array)
members.name: m_Type

members.doc: Width of the texture in pixels at the base mip level
members.name: m_Width

members.doc: Height of the texture in pixels at the base mip level
members.name: m_Height

members.doc: Depth of the texture. Used for 3D textures or texture arrays. For standard 2D textures, this is typically `1`
members.name: m_Depth

members.doc: Width of the original source data before scaling or compression
members.name: m_OriginalWidth

members.doc: Height of the original source data before scaling or compression
members.name: m_OriginalHeight

members.doc: Depth of the original source data
members.name: m_OriginalDepth

members.doc: Number of layers in the texture. Used for array textures (`TEXTURE_TYPE_2D_ARRAY`). For standard 2D textures, this is `1`
members.name: m_LayerCount

members.doc: Number of mipmap levels. A value of `1` means no mipmaps (only the base level is stored). Larger values allow for mipmapped sampling.
members.name: m_MipMapCount

members.doc: Bitfield of usage hints. Indicates how the texture will be used (e.g. sampling, render target, storage image). See dmGraphics::TextureUsageFlag
members.name: m_UsageHintBits

elements.name: TextureCreationParams

elements.description:
Texture filtering modes.
Controls how texels are sampled when scaling or rotating textures

members.doc: Default texture filtering mode. Depeneds on graphics backend (for example, for OpenGL - TEXTURE_FILTER_LINEAR)
members.name: TEXTURE_FILTER_DEFAULT

members.doc: Nearest-neighbor sampling (blocky look, fastest)
members.name: TEXTURE_FILTER_NEAREST

members.doc: Linear interpolation between texels (smooth look)
members.name: TEXTURE_FILTER_LINEAR

members.doc: Nearest mipmap level, nearest texel
members.name: TEXTURE_FILTER_NEAREST_MIPMAP_NEAREST

members.doc: Linear blend between two mipmap levels, nearest texel
members.name: TEXTURE_FILTER_NEAREST_MIPMAP_LINEAR

members.doc: Nearest mipmap level, linear texel
members.name: TEXTURE_FILTER_LINEAR_MIPMAP_NEAREST

members.doc: Linear blend between mipmap levels and texels (trilinear)
members.name: TEXTURE_FILTER_LINEAR_MIPMAP_LINEAR

elements.name: TextureFilter

elements.description:
Pixel formats supported by textures.
Includes uncompressed, compressed, and floating-point variants

members.doc: Packed 16-bit RGB (lower precision, saves memory)
members.name: TEXTURE_FORMAT_RGB_16BPP

members.doc: Packed 16-bit RGBA

members.doc: Depth buffer texture (used for depth testing)

members.name: TEXTURE_FORMAT_RGB_BC1

elements.name: TextureFormat

elements.description: Texture update parameters. Defines a block of pixel data to be uploaded to a texture, along with filtering, wrapping, and sub-region update options. Typically used when calling texture upload/update functions after a texture object has been created with TextureCreationParams

members.doc: Pointer to raw pixel data in CPU memory. The format is defined by `m_Format`
members.name: m_Data

members.doc: Size of the pixel data in bytes. Must match the expected size from width, height, depth, and format
members.name: m_DataSize

members.doc: Format of the pixel data (e.g. RGBA, RGB, compressed formats). Dictates how the GPU interprets the memory pointed by `m_Data`
members.name: m_Format

members.doc: Minification filter (applied when shrinking). Determines how pixels are sampled when the texture is displayed smaller than its native resolution
members.name: m_MinFilter

members.doc: Magnification filter (applied when enlarging). Determines how pixels are sampled when the texture is displayed larger than its native resolution
members.name: m_MagFilter

members.doc: Wrapping mode for U (X) texture coordinate. Controls behavior when texture coordinates exceed [0,1]
members.name: m_UWrap

members.doc: Wrapping mode for V (Y) texture coordinate. Controls behavior when texture coordinates exceed [0,1]
members.name: m_VWrap

members.doc: X offset in pixels for sub-texture updates. Defines the left edge of the destination region
members.name: m_X

members.doc: Y offset in pixels for sub-texture updates. Defines the top edge of the destination region
members.name: m_Y

members.doc: Z offset (depth layer) for 3D textures. Ignored for standard 2D textures
members.name: m_Z

members.doc: Slice index in an array texture where the data should be uploaded
members.name: m_Slice

members.doc: Width of the pixel data block in pixels. Used for both full uploads and sub-updates
members.name: m_Width

members.doc: Height of the pixel data block in pixels. Used for both full uploads and sub-updates
members.name: m_Height

members.doc: Depth of the pixel data block in pixels. Only relevant for 3D textures
members.name: m_Depth

members.doc: Number of layers to update. For array textures, this specifies how many pages are updated
members.name: m_LayerCount

members.doc: Only 7 bit available Mipmap level to update. Level 0 is the base level, higher levels are progressively downscaled versions
members.name: m_MipMap

members.doc: If true, this represents a partial texture update (sub-region), using `m_X`, `m_Y`, `m_Z`, and `m_Slice` offsets. If false, the entire texture/mipmap level is replaced
members.name: m_SubUpdate

elements.name: TextureParams

elements.description: Texture data upload status flags

members.doc: Texture updated and ready-to-use
members.name: TEXTURE_STATUS_OK

members.doc: Data upload to the texture is in progress
members.name: TEXTURE_STATUS_DATA_PENDING

elements.name: TextureStatusFlags

elements.description: Texture types
elements.name: TextureType

elements.description:
Texture addressing/wrapping modes.
Controls behavior when texture coordinates fall outside the [0,1] range

members.doc: Clamp to the color defined as 'border'
members.name: TEXTURE_WRAP_CLAMP_TO_BORDER

members.doc: Clamp to the edge pixel of the texture
members.name: TEXTURE_WRAP_CLAMP_TO_EDGE

members.doc: Repeat texture, mirroring every other repetition
members.name: TEXTURE_WRAP_MIRRORED_REPEAT

members.doc: Repeat texture in a tiled fashion
members.name: TEXTURE_WRAP_REPEAT

elements.name: TextureWrap

elements.description:
Data type.
Represents scalar, vector, matrix, image, or sampler types used
for vertex attributes, uniforms, and shader interface definitions

members.doc: Signed 8-bit integer. Compact storage, often used for colors, normals, or compressed vertex attributes
members.name: TYPE_BYTE

members.doc: Unsigned 8-bit integer. Common for color channels (0–255) or normalized texture data
members.name: TYPE_UNSIGNED_BYTE

members.doc: Signed 16-bit integer. Used for medium-range numeric attributes such as bone weights or coordinates with normalization
members.name: TYPE_SHORT

members.doc: Unsigned 16-bit integer. Often used for indices or normalized attributes when extra precision over bytes is required
members.name: TYPE_UNSIGNED_SHORT

members.doc: Signed 32-bit integer. Typically used for uniform values, shader constants, or counters
members.name: TYPE_INT

members.doc: Unsigned 32-bit integer. Used for indices, IDs, or GPU counters
members.name: TYPE_UNSIGNED_INT

members.doc: 32-bit floating point. Standard for most vertex attributes and uniform values (positions, UVs, weights)
members.name: TYPE_FLOAT

members.doc: 4-component floating-point vector (`vec4` in GLSL). Typically used for homogeneous coordinates, colors (RGBA), or combined attributes
members.name: TYPE_FLOAT_VEC4

members.doc: 4x4 floating-point matrix (`mat4` in GLSL). Standard for 3D transformations (model, view, projection)
members.name: TYPE_FLOAT_MAT4

members.doc: 2D texture sampler. Standard type for most texture lookups
members.name: TYPE_SAMPLER_2D

members.doc: Cube map sampler. Used for environment mapping, reflections, and skyboxes
members.name: TYPE_SAMPLER_CUBE

members.doc: Array of 2D texture samplers. Enables efficient texture indexing when using multiple layers (e.g. terrain textures, sprite atlases)
members.name: TYPE_SAMPLER_2D_ARRAY

members.doc: 2-component floating-point vector (`vec2` in GLSL). Commonly used for texture coordinates or 2D positions
members.name: TYPE_FLOAT_VEC2

members.doc: 3-component floating-point vector (`vec3` in GLSL). Used for positions, normals, and directions in 3D space
members.name: TYPE_FLOAT_VEC3

members.doc: 2x2 floating-point matrix (`mat2` in GLSL). Used in transformations (e.g. 2D rotations, scaling)
members.name: TYPE_FLOAT_MAT2

members.doc: 3x3 floating-point matrix (`mat3` in GLSL). Commonly used for normal matrix calculations in lighting
members.name: TYPE_FLOAT_MAT3

members.doc: 2D image object. Unlike samplers, images allow read/write access in shaders (e.g. compute shaders or image load/store operations)
members.name: TYPE_IMAGE_2D

members.doc: 2D texture object handle. Represents an actual GPU texture resource
members.name: TYPE_TEXTURE_2D

members.doc: Generic sampler handle, used as a placeholder for texture units without specifying the dimension
members.name: TYPE_SAMPLER

members.doc: 2D texture array object handle
members.name: TYPE_TEXTURE_2D_ARRAY

members.doc: Cube map texture object handle
members.name: TYPE_TEXTURE_CUBE

members.doc: 3D texture sampler. Used for volumetric effects, noise fields, or voxel data
members.name: TYPE_SAMPLER_3D

members.doc: 3D texture object handle
members.name: TYPE_TEXTURE_3D

members.doc: 3D image object. Used for compute-based volume processing
members.name: TYPE_IMAGE_3D

members.doc: Array of 3D texture samplers
members.name: TYPE_SAMPLER_3D_ARRAY

members.doc: 3D texture array object handle
members.name: TYPE_TEXTURE_3D_ARRAY

elements.name: Type
